DOC.brief_summary: The aim study ass value MCA PI / UA PI MCA RI / UA RI ratio amniotic fluid volume predict adverse perinatal fetal outcome uncomplicated postdate pregnancy
DOC.brief_title: Middle Cerebral To Umbilical Artery Doppler Ratio And Amniotic Fluid Volume Measurement In Post-date Pregnancies
DOC.detailed_description: The Study Will case-control study conduct Banha University Hospital approval Institutional ethical committee . One hundred pregnant woman recruit antenatal clinic . Starting November 2013 . An informed consent obtain patient . The patient subdivide two group : Group 1 ( Control Group ) : consist fifty pregnant female gestational age 37-40 week . Group 2 ( post date Group ) : consist fifty pregnant female gestational age 41 week . Inclusion criterion : 1 . Singleton , viable fetus vertex presentation . 2 . History regular menstrual cycle . 3 . Gestational age calculate first day last menstryal period first-trimester second-trimester ( 20 week ) ultrasound examination . 4 . No obstetric medical complication pregnancy apart post-date pregnancy All patient subject : 1 . Detailed history : include , personal history , menstural history , obstetric history , present history past history . 2 . Physical examination : general , abdominal pelvic examination . 3 . Investigations : include , A- Ultrasound examintion amniotic fluid index ( AFI ) measurement . B- Doppler study : - Middle cerebral artery pulsatility index ( MCA -PT ) resistace index ( MCA-RI ) . ii - Umbilical artery pulsatility index ( UA-PI ) resistance index ( UA-RT ) . iii - Cerebro-Placental ratio ( CPR ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Singleton , viable fetus vertex presentation 2 . History regular menstrual cycle 3 . Gestational age calculate first day last menstryal period firsttrimester secondtrimester ( 20 week ) ultrasound examination 4 . No obstetric medical complication pregnancy apart postdate pregnancy 1 . Patients unsure date 2 . Medical disorder pregnancy ( hypertension , diabetes mellitus Rh isoimmunization ) 3 . Prelabor rupture membranes 4 . Polyhydramnios 5 . Women multiple pregnancy 6 . Congenital fetal anomaly 7 . Antepartum hemorrhage 8 . Previus cesarean section 9 . Fetal malpresentation
